title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0087

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you another Sci-Fi lesson for all of those fans out there of Star Trek and Star Wars.
segments.cn: 今天我们为所有《星际迷航》和《星球大战》的粉丝带来另一节科幻课。

segments.en: That's right.
And today we're going to focus on some phrases.
segments.cn: 今天我们将专注于一些短语。

segments.en: We're not going to do any vocabulary today.
We're just going to learn some phrases that you'll find relating to science fiction.
segments.cn: 我们只学习一些与科幻相关的短语。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
So why don't we listen to a dialogue for the first time, and we'll come back and look at all these phrases.
segments.cn: 那么我们先听一段对话，然后再回来看看这些短语。

segments.en: Captain, we're under attack by an unidentified ship.
segments.cn: 船长，我们正受到一艘不明船只的攻击。

segments.en: Damage report.
We've sustained heavy damages to the engines.
segments.cn: 我们的引擎受到了严重损坏。

segments.en: We've lost our warp drive.
We'll have to attempt to make contact.
This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the Starship Enterprise.
segments.cn: 我是星际飞船企业号的让-吕克·皮卡德船长。

segments.en: We don't wish to engage.
What is the nature of this attack?
segments.cn: 这次攻击的性质是什么？

segments.en: I am Captain Kor of the ship Krotos.
segments.cn: 我是克罗托斯号的科尔船长。

segments.en: Your ship attacked our search party.
segments.cn: 你们的船攻击了我们的搜索小组。

segments.en: No, you're not doing it right.
Kor doesn't sound like that.
segments.cn: 科尔的声音不是这样的。

segments.en: His voice is deeper.
I am Captain Kor of the ship Krotos.
segments.cn: 我是克罗托斯号的科尔船长。

segments.en: Your ship... No!
If you can't do an authentic Klingon voice, I'll have to find a more serious Star Trek fan who can actually act, okay?
segments.cn: 如果你不能做到真实的克林贡声音，我就得找一个能真正表演的更严肃的《星际迷航》粉丝，好吗？

segments.en: But, but, I already bought the Klingon suit and the wig, Ben.
segments.cn: 但是，我已经买了克林贡的服装和假发，Ben。

segments.en: Alright, very good.
Star Trek fans, apparently they were trying to act out one of the famous episodes where the Klingons attacked the Enterprise.
segments.cn: 《星际迷航》粉丝们，显然他们在尝试表演其中一集著名的剧集，克林贡攻击了企业号。

segments.en: My goodness.
I don't know a lot about Star Trek, but I do know a lot about language.
segments.cn: 我对《星际迷航》了解不多，但我对语言了解很多。

segments.en: And we've got some great stuff here that will help you understand Sci-Fi movies and TV shows in English a little bit better.
segments.cn: 我们这里有一些很棒的内容，可以帮助你更好地理解英语中的科幻电影和电视节目。

segments.en: So why don't we go now to Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在去流利度构建器吧。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
Alright, so the first phrase that we have today on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在流利度构建器上的第一个短语。

segments.en: Unidentified ship.
An unidentified ship.
Unidentified ship.
Unidentified ship.
If we break it down and look at the first word, unidentified.
segments.cn: 如果我们拆分来看第一个词，不明。

segments.en: You don't know which one it is.
Okay, you don't know the identity.
Yep.
And a ship, I guess that's short for...
A rocket ship.
A rocket ship.
Or a spaceship.
Okay.
So we're not talking boats here.
segments.cn: 所以我们不是在谈论船只。

segments.en: Alright, we're not talking about boats.
segments.cn: 好的，我们不是在谈论船只。

segments.en: Very good.
Now moving on to our second phrase.
segments.cn: 现在继续我们的第二个短语。

segments.en: The Enterprise lost its warp drive.
segments.cn: 企业号失去了曲速驱动。

segments.en: Warp drive.
Warp drive.
Warp drive.
So the warp drive of the Enterprise is actually something like an engine that allows it to go faster than the speed of light.
segments.cn: 企业号的曲速驱动实际上是一种引擎，使其能够超过光速。

segments.en: So super fast.
Super fast.
But why warp?
Alright, well if we take a look at the word warp, that actually means to bend.
segments.cn: 好的，如果我们看看曲速这个词，它实际上意味着弯曲。

segments.en: Yep, so like when you warp wood it bends.
segments.cn: 是的，就像当你弯曲木头时，它会弯曲。

segments.en: Exactly, you bend wood or you warp metal.
segments.cn: 正是如此，你弯曲木头或弯曲金属。

segments.en: And well that's kind of the theory behind it is that they're going so fast that they bend or warp time.
segments.cn: 这就是它的理论，他们的速度如此之快，以至于弯曲或扭曲时间。

segments.en: Okay, so warp drive.
I think a very Sci-Fi specific phrase here.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个非常科幻特定的短语。

segments.en: Right.
Alright, and for our third phrase today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们的第三个短语。

segments.en: Search party.
Search party.
A search party.
A search party.
Okay, so what is this?
Are we having a party?
What's going on?
Well, when somebody gets lost, you know, maybe in the woods or something, you send out a search party to find them.
segments.cn: 好吧，当有人迷路时，比如在森林里，你会派出一个搜索小组去找他们。

segments.en: So a party would be a group of people.
So that also happens in restaurants I think, right?
segments.cn: 我想在餐厅也会发生这种情况，对吧？

segments.en: Right, sometimes you might say, how many people in your party?
segments.cn: 对，有时你可能会问，你们小组有多少人？

segments.en: In your party, very good.
segments.cn: 在你们的小组中，非常好。

segments.en: So party group of people.
Alright, so in the dialogue we saw that actually these were not real Star Trek characters, but they were just acting, but it didn't sound quite right, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以在对话中我们看到这些实际上不是《星际迷航》的真实角色，而只是表演，但听起来不太对，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, he said that his voice is deeper.
segments.cn: 是的，他说他的声音更深。

segments.en: So a deep voice.
Deep voice.
A deep voice.
Alright, we're going to hear an example of what a deep voice sounds like.
segments.cn: 好的，我们将听到深沉的声音的例子。

segments.en: The one constant through all the years, Ray, has been baseball.
segments.cn: 多年来唯一不变的，Ray，就是棒球。

segments.en: America has rolled by like an army of steamrollers.
segments.cn: 美国像一支蒸汽滚筒军队一样滚过。

segments.en: It's been erased like a blackboard, rebuilt and erased again.
segments.cn: 它像黑板一样被抹去，重建又被抹去。

segments.en: That is a deep voice.
Now because his voice wasn't deep enough, he didn't sound authentic.
segments.cn: 由于他的声音不够深，他听起来不真实。

segments.en: Authentic.
Authentic.
Alright, so authentic, very easy word.
segments.cn: 好的，所以真实，这个词很简单。

segments.en: Real.
True to life.
Real.
True to life, right?
Not fake.
Exactly.
So Marco, is that an authentic Rolex?
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，这是一只正品劳力士吗？

segments.en: No, it's not.
But thank you for noticing.
Alright, so authentic.
And our last word for today.
A wig.
A wig.
A wig.
Wig.
W-I-G.
Wig.
So a wig is pretend hair, right?
segments.cn: 所以假发是假的头发，对吧？

segments.en: Right, fake hair.
So the hair is not authentic.
Very good.
Alright, so a wig.
Alright, we've got some great language here.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一些很好的语言。

segments.en: And why don't we listen to it one more time, slow down a little bit in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍，稍微放慢对话。

segments.en: Captain, we're under attack by an unidentified ship.
segments.cn: 船长，我们正受到一艘不明船只的攻击。

segments.en: Damage report.
We've sustained heavy damages to the engines.
segments.cn: 我们的引擎受到了严重损坏。

segments.en: We've lost our warp drive.
We'll have to attempt to make contact.
This is Captain Picard of the Starship Enterprise.
segments.cn: 我是企业号星舰的皮卡德船长。

segments.en: We don't wish to engage.
What is the nature of this attack?
segments.cn: 这次攻击的性质是什么？

segments.en: I am Captain Kor of the ship Klothos.
segments.cn: 我是克洛索斯号的科尔船长。

segments.en: Your ship attacked our search party.
segments.cn: 你们的船攻击了我们的搜索小组。

segments.en: No, you're not doing it right.
Kor doesn't sound like that.
segments.cn: 科尔的声音不是这样的。

segments.en: His voice is deeper.
I am Captain Kor of the ship Klothos.
segments.cn: 我是克洛索斯号的科尔船长。

segments.en: Your ship.
No, if you can't do an authentic Klingon voice, I'll have to find a more serious Star Trek fan who can actually act okay.
segments.cn: 不，如果你不能做出真实的克林贡声音，我就得找一个更认真的星际迷航粉丝来演。

segments.en: But, but, I already bought the Klingon suit and the wig.
segments.cn: 但是，我已经买了克林贡的服装和假发。

segments.en: All right, now it's time for us to take a look at more phrases today in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是时候看看今天的更多短语了，在流利构建器中。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
All right, so we've got some phrases here that you can use together with a number of different words, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我们这里有一些短语，你可以和许多不同的词一起使用，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
So the first one, we heard that Data said we're under attack.
segments.cn: 所以第一个，我们听到数据说我们正在受到攻击。

segments.en: We're under attack.
Under attack.
All right, so if we're under attack, it means that we are being...
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果我们正在受到攻击，这意味着我们正在...

segments.en: Attacked.
Attacked.
Someone is shooting guns at you, or trying to hurt you, or something like that.
segments.cn: 有人正在向你开枪，或者试图伤害你，或者类似的事情。

segments.en: Okay, so we are under attack.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们正在受到攻击。

segments.en: Very popular phrase that you would hear in war movies or something.
segments.cn: 这是你在战争电影中会听到的非常流行的短语。

segments.en: Definitely.
Now you can change this by changing the last word.
segments.cn: 现在你可以通过改变最后一个词来改变这个。

segments.en: We are under fire.
segments.cn: 我们正在遭受火力攻击。

segments.en: Under fire, which basically means the same thing.
segments.cn: 正在遭受火力攻击，这基本上意味着同样的事情。

segments.en: Yeah, except when you're under fire, there are guns involved.
segments.cn: 是的，除了当你正在遭受火力攻击时，涉及到枪支。

segments.en: Okay, so they're shooting at you.
segments.cn: 好的，他们正在向你开枪。

segments.en: All right, we're under attack.
segments.cn: 好的，我们正在受到攻击。

segments.en: We're under fire.
segments.cn: 我们正在遭受火力攻击。

segments.en: All right, moving on to our second phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，继续我们的第二个短语。

segments.en: We've sustained heavy damage.
Sustain heavy damage.
So when you sustain something, you receive it or you undergo this thing.
segments.cn: 所以当你遭受某种东西时，你接受它或经历这个东西。

segments.en: So usually it's related to injury or to receiving some type of... Of negative things.
segments.cn: 所以通常与伤害或接受某种... 负面事物有关。

segments.en: Okay, so why don't we listen to some examples of how we could use sustain in context.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们来听一些例子，看看我们如何在上下文中使用“遭受”。

segments.en: Example one.
John had a car accident and sustained a fatal injury.
segments.cn: 约翰发生了车祸，遭受了致命伤。

segments.en: Example two.
The boxer sustained a severe neck injury in the championship fight.
segments.cn: 拳击手在冠军赛中遭受了严重的颈部伤。

segments.en: Example three.
Luckily the warship didn't sustain any serious damage.
segments.cn: 幸运的是，战舰没有遭受任何严重损坏。

segments.en: All right, so you see we typically sustain something like an injury or damage that is negative.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你看到我们通常遭受一些负面的东西，比如伤害或损坏。

segments.en: Very good.
And the last phrase for today.
What is the nature of this attack?
segments.cn: 这次攻击的性质是什么？

segments.en: What is the nature of?
What is the nature of?
Okay, so basically he's just asking why are you doing this?
segments.cn: 好的，所以基本上他只是在问你为什么要这样做？

segments.en: Right, what is the reason?
What is the purpose?
So again we have some more examples of how you could use what is the nature of in different situations.
segments.cn: 所以我们再次有一些例子，看看你如何在不同情况下使用“这是什么性质”。

segments.en: Example one.
What is the nature of your visits to the United States?
segments.cn: 你访问美国的性质是什么？

segments.en: Example two.
What is the nature of the threat against our country?
segments.cn: 针对我们国家的威胁性质是什么？

segments.en: Example three.
The nature of my visit is personal.
segments.cn: 我访问的性质是个人的。

segments.en: Okay, so a great phrase you can use not only when you're talking Sci-Fi but in everyday life.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一个很好的短语，你不仅可以在谈论科幻时使用，也可以在日常生活中使用。

segments.en: Exactly, so why don't we listen now to the dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以我们现在再听一遍对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Captain, we're under attack by an unidentified ship.
segments.cn: 船长，我们正受到一艘不明船只的攻击。

segments.en: Damage report.
We've sustained heavy damages to the engines.
segments.cn: 我们的引擎受到了严重损坏。

segments.en: We've lost our warp drive.
We'll have to attempt to make contact.
This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the Starship Enterprise.
segments.cn: 我是企业号星舰的让-吕克·皮卡德船长。

segments.en: We don't wish to engage.
What is the nature of this attack?
segments.cn: 这次攻击的性质是什么？

segments.en: I am Captain Kor on the ship Krotos.
segments.cn: 我是克罗托斯号的科尔舰长。

segments.en: Your ship attacked our search party.
segments.cn: 你们的飞船攻击了我们的搜索小组。

segments.en: No, you're not doing it right.
Kor doesn't sound like that.
segments.cn: 科尔听起来不是那样的。

segments.en: His voice is deeper.
I am Captain Kor on the ship Krotos.
segments.cn: 我是克罗托斯号的科尔舰长。

segments.en: Your ship-If you can't do an authentic Klingon voice, I'll have to find a more serious Star Trek fan who can actually act, okay?
segments.cn: 你们的飞船——如果你不能做出真实的克林贡声音，我就得找一个更认真的《星际迷航》粉丝来演出，好吗？

segments.en: But, but, I already bought the Klingon suit and the wig.
segments.cn: 可是，我已经买了克林贡的服装和假发。

segments.en: Well Marco, I already admitted that I'm not much of a Sci-Fi fan and I don't really know anything about Star Trek or Star Wars.
segments.cn: 好吧，马尔科，我已经承认我不是个科幻迷，我对《星际迷航》或《星球大战》真的不太了解。

segments.en: Well, it is a very popular show.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是一部非常受欢迎的节目。

segments.en: I think it started around the 60s or 70s.
segments.cn: 我想它大约在60年代或70年代开始。

segments.en: Yep.
The first version of Star Trek.
And well, many, many people follow it now.
segments.cn: 现在，很多很多人都在关注它。

segments.en: They dress up.
They know the secret language that is used on the show.
segments.cn: 他们知道节目中使用的秘密语言。

segments.en: They know the spaceships.
It's a big culture.
That's true.
And speaking of culture, I think we've got a Star Trek movie coming out pretty soon.
segments.cn: 说到文化，我想我们很快就会有一部《星际迷航》的电影上映。

segments.en: So some of this language can help you guys understand it a little bit better.
segments.cn: 所以这些语言可以帮助你们更好地理解它。

segments.en: Very good, yeah.
So if you have any other questions or comments related to, not only to science fiction, but anything in general, please come to the website EnglishPod.com and leave your questions or comments.
segments.cn: 如果你们有任何其他问题或评论，不仅仅是关于科幻的，任何一般性的问题，请访问网站 EnglishPod.com 并留下你们的问题或评论。

segments.en: Well, thanks for downloading you guys.
And until next time, goodbye.
